No extrusion will occur in the opposite normal direction. **Part Dimensions:** - Shape: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.75 units (tapered top)</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Construct a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: (0, 0, -90) * Translation Vector: (0, 0.75, 0) Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the newly created coordinate system. Within this sketch, create a loop with the following curves: * Line 1: Starting at (0, 0) and ending at (0.75, 0) * Line 2: Starting at (0.75, 0) and ending at (0.75, 0.75) * Line 3: Starting at (0.75, 0.75) and ending at (0, 0.75) * Line 4: Starting at (0, 0.75) and ending at (0, 0) Close the loop by connecting Line 1 to Line 4. This loop forms face 1 of the prism. The sketch is complete. Next, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following transformation: * Euler Angles: (0, 0, -90) * Translation Vector: (0, 0.75, 0) After this transformation, extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by a distance of 0.75 units. The extrusion operation can be described as "add materials" to create a solid prism. Part 2: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a central circular hole Construct a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: (-90, 0, -90) * Translation Vector: (0.75, 0, 0.5487) Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the newly created coordinate system. Within this sketch, create a loop with the following curves: * Line 1: Starting at (0, 0) and ending at (0.207, 0) * Line 2: Starting at (0.207, 0) and ending at (0.207, 0.2013) * Line 3: Starting at (0.207, 0.2013) and ending at (0, 0.2013) * Line 4: Starting at (0, 0.2013) and ending at (0, 0) Close the loop by connecting Line 1 to Line 4. This loop forms face 1 of the prism. The sketch is complete. Next, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following transformation: * Euler Angles: (-90, 0, -90) * Translation Vector: (0.75, 0, 0.5487) After this transformation, extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by a distance of 0.225 units, in the opposite direction of the normal vector. The extrusion operation can be described as "remove materials" to create a central circular hole in the solid prism.</description>
